decks.notes: This deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, removal spells like Fatal Push, and disruptive permanents like Null Rod. It also includes card advantage cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck can stabilize the board with creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog while slowly grinding out advantage. The inclusion of cards like Urza's Saga and Lurrus of the Dream-Den provide additional value and recursion options. The deck excels at controlling the game and outmaneuvering opponents.

This Dimir Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by constantly countering their spells, removing their threats, and controlling the game with card advantage. The deck includes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Demonic Tutor to maintain control over the battlefield. It also includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and powerful card draw spells like Dig Through Time to outvalue the opponent. The key strategy is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage until the deck's win conditions like Psychic Frog or Orcish Bowmasters can secure the victory.

The main strategy of this deck is to use various control spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Hullbreacher and Ancestral Recall. The deck also includes powerful win conditions such as Karn, the Great Creator and Bolas's Citadel, along with the Time Vault combo using cards like Manifold Key. With a combination of disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent in a long game of attrition.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck utilizes powerful cards like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Demonic Tutor to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like Null Rod and Wasteland to hinder their opponent's resources. By maintaining a strong board presence with cards like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters, while also having access to powerful spells like Time Walk and Dig Through Time, the deck aims to outmaneuver and control the game.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using hatebears like Chancellor of the Annex and Archon of Emeria, it slows down the opponent's gameplay, while creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Seasoned Dungeoneer provide a consistent attacking presence. The deck also includes mana denial cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The key strategy is to control the board and limit the opponent's options while steadily building towards a win with efficient beaters.

The deck focuses on using aggressive MUD (Mishra's Workshop, Urza's Saga, and artifact-based strategies) to quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful artifacts and disruptive cards like Sphere of Resistance and Phyrexian Revoker. The deck also utilizes key pieces like Time Vault and Voltaic Key to create combo win conditions, while also generating card advantage and mana efficiency with cards like Mystic Forge and Foundry Inspector. Its goal is to establish a dominant board presence early in the game and maintain pressure through a combination of efficient threats and disruptive elements.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact-based ramp and interaction to power out powerful cards and combos, including Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker. It aims to generate mana quickly through cards like Mishra's Workshop and Grim Monolith, while also using cards like Mana Vault and Mana Crypt for additional acceleration. The inclusion of cards like Time Vault and Voltaic Key allows for potential infinite turns, while also having the ability to lock opponents out of the game with cards like Trinisphere and Force of Will. The deck's main goal is to overwhelm opponents with fast, explosive plays and efficient combos.

The deck revolves around utilizing powerful artifact mana sources to generate a large amount of mana quickly, enabling explosive plays with Paradoxical Outcome. By constantly drawing and recasting artifacts, the deck can generate immense card advantage while also setting up a combo finish. The inclusion of various disruption spells, such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, helps protect the combo and control the board state. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently combo off and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful spells and card draw engine.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana and card advantage through artifacts like Mishra's Workshop, Mana Crypt, and Mana Vault. The goal is to use cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Mystic Forge to combo off, generating a lot of value and eventually winning the game with cards like Tinker, Time Vault, and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck aims to control the game early on with counterspells like Force of Will while assembling its combo pieces, leading to a powerful endgame strategy.

The deck aims to quickly assemble key artifacts and disrupt the opponent's game plan with various combo pieces. It utilizes powerful mana acceleration cards like Mana Crypt and Moxen to power out its threats, while also providing protection with Force of Will. The main win condition revolves around using Tinker to fetch Time Vault and establish an infinite turn combo with cards like Manifold Key and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. Additionally, cards like Trinisphere and Vexing Bauble help control the board and disrupt opposing strategies, ultimately allowing the deck to quickly close out the game with its powerful combos.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly building up a board presence with hatebear creatures. It utilizes mana acceleration from Moxen and Ancient Tomb to play out creatures like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent. With disruptive cards like Trinisphere and Wasteland, it aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent with powerful creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Witch Enchanter. The deck is focused on disrupting the opponent's game plan and overwhelming them with efficient threats.

The deck focuses on generating explosive amounts of mana through artifacts like Mox Opal, Grim Monolith, and Mishra's Workshop, allowing for quick and powerful combos with cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker. The deck also utilizes key artifacts such as Sensei's Divining Top, Manifold Key, and The One Ring to draw cards, untap artifacts, and control the board. The inclusion of cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide additional utility and ways to search for key pieces of the combo.

The deck focuses on using hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror. The deck also includes mana acceleration through Moxen and Ancient Tomb, as well as disruption with cards like Wasteland and Trinisphere. The goal is to slow down the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence and closing out the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt and slow down opponents while steadily building up your own board presence. By playing hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, Chancellor of the Annex, and Seasoned Dungeoneer, you can make it difficult for your opponent to execute their game plan. Additionally, cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine can disrupt their mana base, giving you an advantage. With the ability to control the game tempo and put pressure on your opponent, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield and secure a quick victory.

The focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage. The deck utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its powerful threats like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters. In addition, it includes disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Mindbreak Trap to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also features powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to keep up with the opponent and outvalue them in the late game.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to control the opponent's resources and slow down their game plan. By combining hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria with powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen, the deck aims to create a strong board presence while limiting the opponent's options. This strategy is further supported by cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Seasoned Dungeoneer, ensuring that the opponent struggles to execute their game plan effectively. The deck also includes cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and gain additional advantage.
